snippet.textDisplay:
Because then most would have said "hurrdurr you're rehashing The Answer hurrdurr"
I have to agree though, it would have worked, but..
SPOILERS





















The choice given to the P3 cast is different to the dilemma the Phantom Thieves face.
The former is faced with the choice of repeating an absolutely brutal battle in hope of saving a boy who has been lover to some and friend to others, and centerpiece of the year to all.
They fight because some do not want to tarnish the memory of their sacrifice (Akihiko, Ken), some both fear for himself and for the world should they fail (Junpei, Koro), one cannot let him go and is wrecked with guilt at what she has done (Yukari), one has sworn to always support the former in the path in the path of her own happiness, at the cost of her choices (Mitsuru), and one just.. has no idea of what to do. (you/Aigis)

The Phantom Thieves instead made a choice based on principle, as in only pertained to their own happiness and the subsequent erasure of free will accepting Maruki's reality would entail.
While SEES fought to erase a mistake, the Thieves would have fought for their own selfish, individual needs, and while their fight with Maruki is a selfish endeavor indeed, it's still only so on a team basis, in short, the Phantom Thieves as a team had decided to take back their free will, just as they had done back in December.
snippet.textOriginal:
Because then most would have said "hurrdurr you're rehashing The Answer hurrdurr"
I have to agree though, it would have worked, but..
SPOILERS





















The choice given to the P3 cast is different to the dilemma the Phantom Thieves face.
The former is faced with the choice of repeating an absolutely brutal battle in hope of saving a boy who has been lover to some and friend to others, and centerpiece of the year to all.
They fight because some do not want to tarnish the memory of their sacrifice (Akihiko, Ken), some both fear for himself and for the world should they fail (Junpei, Koro), one cannot let him go and is wrecked with guilt at what she has done (Yukari), one has sworn to always support the former in the path in the path of her own happiness, at the cost of her choices (Mitsuru), and one just.. has no idea of what to do. (you/Aigis)

The Phantom Thieves instead made a choice based on principle, as in only pertained to their own happiness and the subsequent erasure of free will accepting Maruki's reality would entail.
While SEES fought to erase a mistake, the Thieves would have fought for their own selfish, individual needs, and while their fight with Maruki is a selfish endeavor indeed, it's still only so on a team basis, in short, the Phantom Thieves as a team had decided to take back their free will, just as they had done back in December.

snippet.textDisplay:
P5R SPOILERS



Now that I think about it, they certainly could have done it. They could have had your party members try to stop you from changing reality. They did it with Kasumi. Why couldn't they do it with the rest of the thieves. Woulda made it a lot more satisfying than just talking to them.
snippet.textOriginal:
P5R SPOILERS



Now that I think about it, they certainly could have done it. They could have had your party members try to stop you from changing reality. They did it with Kasumi. Why couldn't they do it with the rest of the thieves. Woulda made it a lot more satisfying than just talking to them.

snippet.textDisplay: The first 15s alone make this one of the best videogame soundtrack ever
snippet.textOriginal: The first 15s alone make this one of the best videogame soundtrack ever

snippet.textDisplay:
(Beginning chorus)

Grief... causes regression.
I cannot control my other self.

Shifting into many forms.
That Origia Mode cannot bestow upon...

(Instrumental break)

(Verse)
Now I know, for the pain of loss.
The dreams.. of a butterfly
As I see, his face again. It’s hurts as I cast away myself.

But fighting over a key?
It’s curse that I must endure.

Do we have to fight over this?
And reset everything..? Or move on blindly?

(Chorus)
Listen to my Heartful Cry!
As I say I need your help!
Listen to my Heartful Cry!
And his seal rests forever more.
Listen to my Heartful Cry!
Let my sister awaken your mind.
Listen to my Heartful Cry!
As my mechanical heart cannot bare no more..

(Repeat the verse)
snippet.textOriginal:
(Beginning chorus)

Grief... causes regression.
I cannot control my other self.

Shifting into many forms.
That Origia Mode cannot bestow upon...

(Instrumental break)

(Verse)
Now I know, for the pain of loss.
The dreams.. of a butterfly
As I see, his face again. It’s hurts as I cast away myself.

But fighting over a key?
It’s curse that I must endure.

Do we have to fight over this?
And reset everything..? Or move on blindly?

(Chorus)
Listen to my Heartful Cry!
As I say I need your help!
Listen to my Heartful Cry!
And his seal rests forever more.
Listen to my Heartful Cry!
Let my sister awaken your mind.
Listen to my Heartful Cry!
As my mechanical heart cannot bare no more..

(Repeat the verse)

snippet.textDisplay: Definitely in the minority, but I thoroughly enjoyed just about everything in The Answer, especially the battle mechanics and was never bothered by not having S. Links either. I especially loved how surprisingly deep the main plot was and how it continued to develop on the already fantastic cast of P3. Maybe it's because it wasn't one of my first SMT games but I was never raging at any point nor did I find it too difficult either.
snippet.textOriginal: Definitely in the minority, but I thoroughly enjoyed just about everything in The Answer, especially the battle mechanics and was never bothered by not having S. Links either. I especially loved how surprisingly deep the main plot was and how it continued to develop on the already fantastic cast of P3. Maybe it's because it wasn't one of my first SMT games but I was never raging at any point nor did I find it too difficult either.

snippet.textDisplay: @Game Sneak 100% agree with this comment. Finished the answer and coming straight from the journey and loving it, I really love the answer. I have an unpopular opinion but I love the battle mechanics of P3. It truly makes me feel that I'm playing with other people. Cuz of that, I never minded fighting in the answer and going through constantly. Plus idk why people dislike the story of the answer but it's so amazing and I really like how there's more charater development and more story
snippet.textOriginal: @Game Sneak 100% agree with this comment. Finished the answer and coming straight from the journey and loving it, I really love the answer. I have an unpopular opinion but I love the battle mechanics of P3. It truly makes me feel that I'm playing with other people. Cuz of that, I never minded fighting in the answer and going through constantly. Plus idk why people dislike the story of the answer but it's so amazing and I really like how there's more charater development and more story

snippet.textDisplay:
Lo jugué y lo terminé al 100% raramente termino un juego al 100%
pero eset fue la excepción me dejó muy encariñado con todos sus personajes, al principio el juego me pareció un cliché más
protagonistas con un pasado turbio ¡bah! pensé, que aburrido 
pero, decidí continuar con esta aventura, y me fui olvidando de los clichés poco a poco y lo fui queriendo más queriendo a los protagonistas del juego a junpei iori mi idiota favorito el juego me hizo valorar más la vida y me hizo ver que la gente sin amistades no puede avanzar y las situaciones tan agradables o tan tristes que puedes experimentar al tener buenos amigos me hizo valorar a mis compañeros de la preparatoria y querer conocerlos y hacer lazos con ellos, lo importante que son los lazos con otras personas para poder lograr tus objetivos es un lindo mensaje que deja persona3 
muy recomendado

snippet.textDisplay:
@fr801 yeah, P3P fixed a lot of things, it was too bad the overworld got sacrificed for it though. Really, we need a truly definitive version of Persona 3, I mean, currently you have to bounce between P3P and FES, as the features they added were exclusive to the respective versions. Imagine a P3 game on the Vita that included all the content from P3P, as well as all the content from FES, while keeping the overworld as well. It would be amazing.

Also, I guess it varies from player to player, but my experience with Mitsuru was just terrible and for me her AI was really dumb, so I ended up using Ken, Koromaru, and Shinji as my go to team. Subbed in Aigis for Shinji towards the end.
snippet.textOriginal:
@fr801 yeah, P3P fixed a lot of things, it was too bad the overworld got sacrificed for it though. Really, we need a truly definitive version of Persona 3, I mean, currently you have to bounce between P3P and FES, as the features they added were exclusive to the respective versions. Imagine a P3 game on the Vita that included all the content from P3P, as well as all the content from FES, while keeping the overworld as well. It would be amazing.

Also, I guess it varies from player to player, but my experience with Mitsuru was just terrible and for me her AI was really dumb, so I ended up using Ken, Koromaru, and Shinji as my go to team. Subbed in Aigis for Shinji towards the end.

snippet.textDisplay: @Uploaded It's not that bad though lol And at least in the PSP version we can choose specific commands like in PErsona 4 =P
snippet.textOriginal: @Uploaded It's not that bad though lol And at least in the PSP version we can choose specific commands like in PErsona 4 =P

snippet.textDisplay:
+John Adams 
The best compromise would be to let the player choose each team members' orders, between either stuff like "all out offensive" "Heal and buff" etc, or, Direct Commands. It would be ace to be able to do that for each specific party member, that way you could have Shinji and Koromaru on a vague command, and use Mitsuru on Direct Command, making her not use the same dumbass stupid move over and over.


Would fix a lot of problems in general, would allow players that wanted to to keep that level of immersion, while some players that would want to command each party member to do their thing.
snippet.textOriginal:
+John Adams 
The best compromise would be to let the player choose each team members' orders, between either stuff like "all out offensive" "Heal and buff" etc, or, Direct Commands. It would be ace to be able to do that for each specific party member, that way you could have Shinji and Koromaru on a vague command, and use Mitsuru on Direct Command, making her not use the same dumbass stupid move over and over.


Would fix a lot of problems in general, would allow players that wanted to to keep that level of immersion, while some players that would want to command each party member to do their thing.

snippet.textDisplay: @phantasticgoose Yeah, my first time through, Junpei's turn somehow got sandwiched between both of Nyx's turns and was stayed there no matter how many time I revived him. He was killing himself every 2 or 3 turns.
snippet.textOriginal: @phantasticgoose Yeah, my first time through, Junpei's turn somehow got sandwiched between both of Nyx's turns and was stayed there no matter how many time I revived him. He was killing himself every 2 or 3 turns.

snippet.textDisplay:
I find that with most of the commands, they'll do what you want them to do. Sometimes Mitsuru is kind of dumb with Mind Charge on Full Assault, but for the most part they do what you tell them to do.

Until you get to Heal/Support, where they just do the most idiotic things. It's hard for me to justify using Yukari and lolKen for bosses since everyone has to be on their last legs before they use party healing spells. Aigis is also pretty dumb with her buffs when she's on Support. And don't get started on when Yukari and Mitsuru get their break spells...
snippet.textOriginal:
I find that with most of the commands, they'll do what you want them to do. Sometimes Mitsuru is kind of dumb with Mind Charge on Full Assault, but for the most part they do what you tell them to do.

Until you get to Heal/Support, where they just do the most idiotic things. It's hard for me to justify using Yukari and lolKen for bosses since everyone has to be on their last legs before they use party healing spells. Aigis is also pretty dumb with her buffs when she's on Support. And don't get started on when Yukari and Mitsuru get their break spells...

snippet.textDisplay: Well, I wouldn't exactly call it a dating sim. In a dating sim the ultimate objective is usually to, you know, date a girl. In Persona you have to build your relationships with people to be able to fuse better Personas and stuff like that. Of course, once you build your relationship with a female character to its max limit, you get the chance to date her. But it's still just optional, and your relationships with the male characters are just as important.
snippet.textOriginal: Well, I wouldn't exactly call it a dating sim. In a dating sim the ultimate objective is usually to, you know, date a girl. In Persona you have to build your relationships with people to be able to fuse better Personas and stuff like that. Of course, once you build your relationship with a female character to its max limit, you get the chance to date her. But it's still just optional, and your relationships with the male characters are just as important.

snippet.textDisplay: This comment is so, so old, but I'm replying anyway.  The full moon bosses were easier than the floor bosses because there were a ton of cutscenes before most of them without any save points, as well as other encounters.  (For comparison's sake, not counting final bosses, P4 and, for the most part, P5 had nothing leading up to the boss.)
snippet.textOriginal: This comment is so, so old, but I'm replying anyway.  The full moon bosses were easier than the floor bosses because there were a ton of cutscenes before most of them without any save points, as well as other encounters.  (For comparison's sake, not counting final bosses, P4 and, for the most part, P5 had nothing leading up to the boss.)

snippet.textDisplay:
MoMagnus93 Since it has been another 4 months I will slap down another reply.

Tbh I think the AI controlled allies were fake difficulty, because the only reason any fight in P3 is "difficult," is because your allies would decide to make stupid decisions.

And since we're on an Answer video, The Answer was also fake difficulty because all it did was just add an extra layer of RNG to the combat.
